publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

lg.l: Robin, to beggars, with a curse
Throws the last shilling in his purse,
And, when the Coach-man comes for pay,
The Rogue must call another day.Grave Harry, when the poor are pressing
Gives them a peny, and God's blessing
But, always carefull of the main,
With two pence overy left, walks home in rain.Robin from noon to night will prate,
Runs out in tongue, as in estate;
And e'er a twelvemonth and a day
Will not have one new thing to say.
Much talking is not Harry's vice,
He need not tell a Story twice,
And, if he always be so thrifty,
His fund may last to five and fifty.It so fell out, that cautious Harry
As Soldiers use, for love must marry,
And with his Dame the ocean crosst,
All for Love, or the world well lost.
Repairs a cabin gone to ruin,
Iust big enough to shelter two in;
And, in his house, if any body come,
Will make them welcome to his modicum:
Where Goody Iulia milks the Cows,
And boyls Potatoes for her spouse,
Or darns his hose, or mends his Breeches,
While Harry's fencing up his ditches.Robin, who ne'r his mind could fix
To live without a coach and Six,
To patch his broken fortunes, found
A Mistress worth five thousand pound;
Swears, he could get her in an hour
If G overgaffer Harry would endow her;
And Sell, to pacify his wrath,
A Birth-right for a mess of broth.Young Harry, as all Europe knows,
Was long the quintessence of Beaux;
But, when espous'd, he ran the fate
That must attend the marry'd state;
From gold brocade and shining armour,
Was metamorphos'd to a farmer;
His Grazier's coat with dirt besmear'd,
Nor, twice a weeka week will shave his beard.Old Robin, all his youth a Sloven,
At fifty-two, when he grew loving,
Clad in a coat of Podesway,
A flaxen wig, and wast-coat gay,
Powder'd from shoulder down to flank,
In courtly style addresses Franck;
Twice ten years older than his wife
Is doom'd to be a Beau for life:
Supplying those defects by dress
Which I must leave the world to guess.878-521V
